L0_to_L1.name: Activation
L0_to_L1.description: Phase-extended activation from latent to stable active regime
inference_notes: Transition region has mixed L0/L1 characteristics
Inference rules must account for partial activation
Critical threshold crossing may exhibit hysteresis

L1_to_L2.name: Complexification
L1_to_L2.description: Transition from stable to complex active dynamics
inference_notes: No sharp boundary between L1 and L2

L2_to_L3.name: Deactivation
L2_to_L3.description: Transition from active complex dynamics to residual structure
characteristics: Energy throughput falls below maintenance thresholds
Feedback mechanisms no longer sustain coherence
Structural coupling weakens or breaks down
System transitions from process to residue
inference_notes: Most critical boundary for inference validity
Residual structure preserves some information but not process
Crossing this boundary terminates predictive models

L3_to_L0.name: Cyclical Reset
L3_to_L0.description: Residual structure becomes latent configuration for new cycle
characteristics: L3 structure persists as potential L0 configuration
New boundary conditions may activate latent structure
Information from previous cycle encoded in configuration
No continuous temporal connection between cycles
inference_notes: This is not a temporal transition but a conceptual cycle
New L0 state may incorporate L3 structure from previous systems
Causal continuity is broken; only structural inheritance remains
Enables multi-cycle analysis without assuming temporal linearity

transition_properties.description: All transitions are phase-extended rather than instantaneous. This means inference validity gradually changes across transition regions.

regime_leakage_risk.definition: Applying inference rules from one regime to another regime where those rules are invalid
regime_leakage_risk.mitigation: Explicit regime tracking and boundary recognition in models
